items.title: Nvidia acquires Solver, a three-year-old AI coding agent startup formerly known as Laredo Labs, which had raised $8M from Radical Ventures and other investors (The Information)
items.summary:
The Information:
Nvidia acquires Solver, a three-year-old AI coding agent startup formerly known as Laredo Labs, which had raised $8M from Radical Ventures and other investors  —  Nvidia has acquired Solver, a three-year-old software development startup, The Information reported Tuesday.

items.title: Quickly measure up to 393-foot distances with this dual laser tool with USB-C charging at $30 (Save 25%)
items.summary:
Kiprim 393-foot Dual Laser Distance Measuring Tool

Buy for $30 (Reg. $40)

What we love

Most of the time, a measuring tape works just fine for smaller projects. But when tackling something bigger, a powerful unit is bound to come in handy. It boasts two lasers, with one that shoots out each direction to independently capture roughly 196 feet from either end. Accuracy is said to come within “2mm” and this unit can “instantly calculate area, volume, or distances using Pythagorean functions.”

items.summary:
Belkin’s new Qi2.2 25W MagSafe stands are already up for purchase ahead of iPhone 17, and it is likely only a matter of time before it updates its MagSafe car charger with more power too. But it’s likely going to cost you whole lot more than the $39.99 shipped sale price for the current 15W model we are tracking on Amazon right now. Question is whether or not the extra 10W of juice is worth paying what will almost certainly be close to double the price for the new Belkin one, or just paying the same $40 for the new UGREEN 25W model.

more…

items.title: Google avoids break up, but has to give up exclusive search deals in  antitrust trial
items.summary: U.S. District Court Judge Amit P. Mehta outlined remedies on Tuesday that would bar Google from entering or maintaining exclusive deals that tie the distribution of Search, Chrome, Google Assistant, or Gemini to other apps or revenue arrangements.

items.title: tomtoc’s vibrant red and white Nintendo Switch 2 crossbody bag hits $42.50 (Reg. $50), more
items.summary:
tomtoc Nintendo Switch 2 Crossbody Bag

Buy for $42.50 (Reg. $50)

What we love

The red and white colorway of this bag has caught my eye since it first arrived at Amazon roughly 5 months ago. While a lot of options go with boring gray or black styles, this one really pops if you ask me. Inside you’ll find room for Nintendo’s latest console, 8 cartridges, and more. And if you aren’t feeling the red and white style, you can also opt for one of the other designs for the same price.

items.title: OpenAI to route sensitive conversations to GPT-5, introduce parental controls
items.summary: OpenAI said Tuesday it plans to route sensitive conversations to reasoning models like GPT-5 and roll out parental controls within the next month – part of an ongoing response to recent safety incidents involving ChatGPT failing to detect mental distress.

items.title: Heybike’s End of Summer Sale offers Mars 2.0 folding e-bike extra battery bundle back at a $1,199 low, more
items.summary:
Heybike has switched over to its End of Summer Sale event that is seeing up to $649 in savings across a condensed e-bike list, with many of them also receiving free bundled gear too. Among the offers, we’re seeing a second-time chance at Heybike’s Mars 2.0 Folding Fat-Tire e-bike coming with an extra battery for double the mileage at $1,199 shipped, with the option to forgo the bundle and get the standard e-bike’s package with a front and rear basket starting from $999 shipped. Normally, this twice-offered bundle with the battery would cost $1,848 without any savings, which we first saw pop up two weeks ago in the early days of the brand’s Labor Day Sale. It’s coming back around here, likely in an ongoing response to the release of the new upgraded Mars 3.0 e-bike, giving you $649 in total savings at the lowest price we have tracked. Head below for more on this model and the others seeing discounts in this sale.

more…

items.title: This stylish short sleeve turtleneck sweater is on sale in a variety of styles from $19 (Save 37%)
items.summary:
COOFANDY Short Sleeve Turtleneck Sweater

Buy for $19 (Reg. $30)

Clip the on-page 5% off coupon.

What we love

This turtleneck sweater allows you to stylishly dress a bit warmer without giving in to long sleeves. Instead, it offers thicker material than what you’d usually have with a t-shirt and the turtleneck design should help keep you warm as well. There are loads of colorways and sizes to choose from here, many of which are on sale for this price.

items.title: Judges side with Trump EPA over canceled Inflation Reduction Act grants to nonprofits
items.summary: An appellate court found that the Trump administration was within its rights to cancel billions of dollars in grants. The nonprofits that had their grants canceled are expected to appeal.

items.title: Amazon launches Lens Live, an AI-powered shopping tool for use in the real world
items.summary: Lens Live will not replace Amazon's existing visual search tool, Amazon Lens, which lets you take a picture, upload an image, or scan a barcode to discover products. Instead, it brings a real-time component to Amazon Lens.

items.title: elago’s MagSafe suction cup mount latches your iPhone onto smooth surfaces for $11 Prime shipped
items.summary:
elago MagSafe Suction Cup Mount

Buy for $11 (Reg. $13)

Clip the on-page 10% off coupon.

What we love

If you want an easy way to latch your iPhone onto smooth surfaces, this suction cup mount from elago is certainly worth a look. On one side you’ll find MagSafe, which makes it a cinch to snap it onto your iPhone. From there you can quickly attach your device to a mirror, window, plus a wide variety of other smooth surfaces as well.

items.title: Make up to 100 cuts, even in tight spaces, with Worx’s 20V 5-inch mini cordless chainsaw at $90 (Reg. $130)
items.summary:
Amazon is offering the Worx 20V 5-inch Mini Cordless Chainsaw at $90.33 shipped. It’s down from its $130 full price tag, which we’ve mostly seen dropping to $100 over the last few months, though costs have occasionally fallen lower to $89, $85, and the one-time $84 low that appeared during July’s Prime Day event. Things are down among its lowest rates right now, with the 31% markdown here cutting $40 off the going rate for the best price since Prime Day.

Regularly $49 straight from Nothing where they are currently on sale for $28, you’ll find them down at just $19.99 with free shipping for Prime members or in orders over $35 at Amazon right now.

items.title: Tested: Camp Chef’s Woodwind Pro series bridges the age-old pellet grill gap
items.summary:
Pellet smokers, in general, are divisive. Many cooks and enthusiasts favor the convenience of pellets, while purists and even those grounded by taste suggest offsets and traditional smokers are the more favorable option. The Woodwind Pro from Camp Chef is ready to dispel those notions by bringing real wood flavor to an otherwise simple, but excellent, experience.

Buy for $7.50 (Reg. $12)

I have not one, but two MagSafe mounts in my vehicle. This allows both the driver and passenger to have a place to lock their iPhones in place. It’s very nice to keep my pocket empty and have a second screen that levels up my CarPlay experience.

items.title: Amazon low strikes Anker’s new display-equipped 10K Nano power bank with retractable cable at $50
items.summary:
Anker’s Labor Day deals, in case you missed them earlier, are still going strong, and one of them drops the brand’s new 10,000mAh Nano power bank down to $49.99 shipped. This particular model debuted in July carrying a $60 price tag alongside other models in the brand’s Nano lineup, and it’s now seeing its first post-launch deal at Amazon courtesy of the brand’s official storefront. It comes in three colors, though only the black and white versions are down to $50 – the green option is still fetching its full price. Today’s 17% drop takes $10 off its usual going rate, putting it just $1.50 above the launch promotion that briefly had it at $48.50. Head below for more details.

Marsail 55- by 28-inch Electric Standing Desk

Buy for $110 (Reg. $160)

What we love

A lot of the standing desks we spot on sale are around 48 inches in size, this model steps things up with a 55-inch design. Additionally, the depth clocks in at 28 inches, which adds 4 more inches than you’d typically get. The height can be changed to anywhere from 27.5 to 46.7 inches and there are built-in memory presets so you can quickly return to standing or sitting height.
